meanings.definition: The dispersion of any people from their original homeland.
meanings.sent1: The diaspora of my family happened when we moved to a new country.
meanings.sent2: The Jewish diaspora has spread across many countries over the centuries.
meanings.sent3: The diaspora of ants from the picnic blanket was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The diaspora of ideas from one culture to another enriches both.
meanings.sent5: The diaspora of seeds by the wind ensures new plants grow in different places.

meanings.definition: A group of people who live outside the area in which they had lived for a long time or in which their ancestors lived.
meanings.sent1: The Chinese diaspora in America celebrates their heritage through festivals.
meanings.sent2: The Irish diaspora in Boston has a strong sense of community.
meanings.sent3: The diaspora of squirrels in the park always finds a way to steal snacks.
meanings.sent4: The diaspora of stars in the night sky creates a beautiful tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The diaspora of books in the library allows readers to explore different genres.
